citation.article-title: Holospora (ex Hafkine 1890) nom. rev., a genus of bacteria inhabiting the nuclei of paramecia.

p.s: Description of Holospora obtusa (ex Hafkine 1890) nom. rev., emend.
Holospora obtusa (ob.tu'sa. L. adj. obtusus obtuse.)
Cells develop in the macronuclei of P. caudatum.
The vegetative rods have rounded ends and are about 3 μm long.
The infectious cells are elongated and straight and are about 18 μm long.
The type is the original description and illustration of Hafkine (8).

Clone M-115 of P. caudatum containing H. obtusa in its macronuclei has been deposited in the culture collection of the Laboratory of Invertebrate Zoology, Biological Research Institute, Leningrad University.
